PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY
Health, safety and environmental stewardship are a core value and the primary focus of the Company..  Adhering to safe work practices and following all of the rules and elements of the Company's Safety Program is a condition of employment at RG Steel.  At RG Steel, our safety programs are based on the following commitments to prevent injury and illness by: 
	I.   Enacting proper health and safety actions and practices at work through personal examples; 
	II.  Requiring safe job performance by employees and contractors;
	III. Ensuring safe work environments by taking the necessary actions to prevent unsafe conditions and risky actions in the work place; 
	IV.  Providing continuing and mandatory safety training.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

The Plan provides for the prompt, orderly and effective mobilization and coordination of key plant, community and security personnel in response to a disaster.  A disaster is defined as any incident bringing a potential for great damage, loss or destruction to equipÂ¬ment, employees or production that necessitates the use of community assistance.  Examples of disasters are explosions, fires, hazardous chemical accidents, bomb threats, transportation accidents, riots, industrial accidents and natural disasters. ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES
It is RG Steel, LLC's policy that the employees and facilities operate in a manner that protects the health and welfare of our employees, visitors, the community at large and the environment.  

Health, safety and environmental stewardship are a core value and the primary focus of our daily work.  Each employee is responsible for doing their part in maintaining a safe and healthful workplace. Adhering to safe work practices and following all of the rules and elements of the Company's Safety Program is a condition of employment at RG Steel.  Likewise, compliance with environmental programs is a key responsibility of every RG Steel employee in accordance with their roles and responsibility within the organization.

RG Steel, LLC will maintain health, safety, and environmental (HSE) programs conforming to the best practices of global manufacturing organizations.  These practices include policies for accidental release prevention and emergency response and shall be implemented within the framework of our ISO 14001 and OHSAS 18001 certified management systems.


OUR FACILITY AND THE REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED
The primary purpose of this facility is the manufacturing of iron and steel.   An annealing process is performed at several finishing operations as part of the manufacturing of sheet steel. Annealing is a heat treatment wherein a material is altered, causing changes in its properties such as strength and hardness.  This process is performed by substantially heating the material for a while and allowing it to cool. 

Annealing is carried out in a special atmosphere, either hydrogen or a mixture of hydrogen and nitrogen.   Annealing gas is produced for the steel mill by blending together nitrogen and hydrogen gas.
